title: Ticket #2222: EC2 (Query) GAHP failure?
description:
Date: Thu, 09 Jun 2011 22:26:09 -0500
  From: Seo-Young Noh <rsyoung@kisti.re.kr>
  To: Todd L Miller <tlmiller@cs.wisc.edu>
  Cc: Steven Timm <timm@fnal.gov>
  Subject: Re: [Fwd: Re: demo code for EC2-Rest interface? (fwd)]


  Hi Todd,


  I am trying to submit a vm to EC2 using condor, but I have no luck to
  succeed it. I am sorry, but could you take a look at "job description
  file" and the error message, and give me your idea how I can solve this
  problem. Log message shows "Grid/Globus Resource Down", but the url
  seems working fine because my HybridFox can retrieve data from the url.


  universe        = grid
  grid_resource   = ec2 https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com


  executable       = dummy.sh


  ec2_ami_id       = ami-8e1fece7
  ec2_instance_type = m1.large


  ec2_access_key_id = ./keyfiles/AccessKey.File
  ec2_secret_access_key = ./keyfiles/SecretKey.File
  ec2_keypair_file = ./keyfiles/rsyoung_keypair


  ec2_user_data   = vm submission from condor


  +owner          = undefined
  log             = vmsub.log


  queue   1

vmsub.log 
  000 (007.000.000) 06/09 22:17:27 Job submitted from host:
  <131.225.154.149:9687>
  ...
  020 (007.000.000) 06/09 22:17:36 Detected Down Globus Resource
      RM-Contact: https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com
  ...
  026 (007.000.000) 06/09 22:17:36 Detected Down Grid Resource
      GridResource: ec2 https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com
  ...


  Thank you.


  Seo-Young


  On Tue, 2011-05-31 at 16:07 -0500, Todd L Miller wrote:
  > > x86_64/rhap5, please.
  >
  >
  http://nmi-s004.cs.wisc.edu/nmi/condor-7.7.0-338616-x86_64_rhap_5-unstripped.tar.gz
  >
  >       Unstripped in case Something Terrible happens.  All the usual
  > disclaimers apply.
  >
  > - Todd
remarks:
2011-Jun-10 11:09:05 by tlmiller:
Unable to reproduce locally. Asked user for the EC2 GAHP log.

2011-Jun-10 11:56:15 by tlmiller: 

  Thanks Tod.


  I finally got a clue from your email -- "the keyfile." I found a missing
  one character from my access key id.


  Now an instance is running. Below is a log


  Thank you very much!
creator: tlmiller
